notes: The design integrates traditional Kerala architectural features such as the Nalukettu layout with a central courtyard and interconnected rooms.
Vastu principles have been observed by placing key rooms in their prescribed directional zones (e.g., master bedroom to the south or west, depending on local norms).
The servant's quarters are positioned discreetly yet functionally near the kitchen area for operational efficiency.
A large garden is incorporated on the eastern side of the plot to ensure a pleasant outdoor living environment.
Local building norms and sustainability standards have been adhered to in the design.
